edge: Ritesh Batra initiated the idea of making a film based on his research for a documentary on dabbawala in 2007, which led to the scripting of the movie.
Rutvik Oza assisted Ritesh Batra in completing the first draft of the screenplay for the movie in 2011.
Sikhya Entertainment was a joint production company for the movie.
DAR motion pictures was a joint production company for the movie.

edge: National Film Development Corporation of India (NFDC) was a joint production company for the movie.

ASAP Films was a joint production company for the movie from France.
Cine Mosaic, owned by Lydia Dean Pilcher, became the international sales agent of the movie.
Ritesh Batra completed the first draft of the screenplay for the movie in 2011.
The script of the movie was mentored at the Torino Film Festival's screenwriter's lab.
Nimrat Kaur played the character named Ila in the movie.
The character of Ila was portrayed for a duration of six months in the movie.

In this context, 'documentary manner' refers to a style of filming that aims to depict reality as accurately and objectively as possible. Footage in this case, refers to the actual filmed material captured during this style of filming.
The footage taken in a documentary manner were later used to create scenes for the film.
During the filming of Mumbai's famous dabbawalas, a four-member film crew followed them to document their process. This was done in a documentary style.
The famous dabbawalas are an integral part of Mumbai's culture. In this context, they were provided lunchboxes to deliver in a documentary style.
The majority of the film's scenes were shot during a three-week period.
